request.description:
This method is used to create a schema. A Schema can be thought of as a container of tables that are independent from tables in other schemas. An example might be the Schema dev could have a table called dog. The Schema Prod could also have a table called dog.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_schema
  • schema (required) - name of the schema you are creating

This method is used to create a table under the specified schema.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_table
  • schema (required) - name of the schema where you want your table to live
  • table (required) - name of the table you are creating
  • hash_attribute (required) - hash for the table

This method is used to create a schema. A Schema can be thought of as a container of tables that are independent from tables in other schemas. An example might be the Schema dev could have a table called dog. The Schema Prod could also have a table called dog.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_schema
  • schema (required) - name of the schema you are creating

This method is used to create a schema. A Schema can be thought of as a container of tables that are independent from tables in other schemas. An example might be the Schema dev could have a table called dog. The Schema Prod could also have a table called dog.

  • table (required) - name of the table you are creating
  • hash_attribute (required) - hash for the table

See our article on importing data sets here: http://harperdbhelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002007573-1Gigabyte-Limit-to-Request-Bodies NOTE: Hash value of the inserted JSON record MUST be supplied on insert.
  • operation (required) - must always be 'insert'
  • schema (required) - schema where the table you are inserting records into lives
  • table (required) - table where you want to insert records
  • records (required) - array of one or more records for insert

This method is used to create a schema. A Schema can be thought of as a container of tables that are independent from tables in other schemas. An example might be the Schema dev could have a table called dog. The Schema Prod could also have a table called dog.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_schema
  • schema (required) - name of the schema you are creating

This method is used to create a table under the specified schema.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_table
  • schema (required) - name of the schema where you want your table to live
  • table (required) - name of the table you are creating
  • hash_attribute (required) - hash for the table
